Key Match Events: Virat Kohli hit 95 as India chased down its target of 274 to beat New Zealand.
India won by four wickets after reaching its target with 12 balls left.
Daryl Mitchell made a rapid 130 for New Zealand.
Mohammed Shami claimed 5-54 in his first match of the tournament.
Rohit Sharma led India's start with 46 runs.
Kohli's fourth 50-plus score in five innings helped India secure the win.
Pre-Game Insights: India's star all-rounder Hardik Pandya was unavailable due to a left ankle injury.
Suryakumar Yadav replaced Hardik Pandya in the lineup.
India brought in pacer Shami for bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur.
New Zealand were unchanged from their previous win over Afghanistan.
Kane Williamson was unavailable due to a thumb injury, and Tom Latham led the side.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India's fifth straight win to open the tournament puts them at the top of the table.
New Zealand are second after their first loss.
Mitchell forged a 159-run partnership with Rachin Ravindra (75).
